name: Vegetarian Hoppin' John
author: plasticmsg
summary: Both of my daughters are vegetarians. I developed this simple recipe for them to let them enjoy Hoppin' John. It can be used as a base for additional ingredients according to personal preference. This recipe was submitted to the Harvard College Dining Services and was selected as a vegetarian option for the student dining halls.
ingredients: 2 (15 ounce) cans black-eyed peas, rinsed and drained
directions: Bring broth and rice to a boil in a saucepan
Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes
Heat olive oil in a pot over medium-high heat
Saute onion in hot oil until translucent, 5 to 7 minutes
Stir rice, black-eyed peas, and Cajun seasoning into onion, cover the pot with a lid, and cook until flavors blend, about 10 minutes
